{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3349009,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T13:26:21.592Z","cooked":"

We’re running into a problem where our Roborio 1.0 reports no robot code upon first time boot. But it is resolved by restarting the roborio from the driver station.

Was there a WPILib update that resolved an issue like this that I just missed? I wish I had some console logs to share, but sadly I don’t at this time.

Just wondering if other teams have experienced anything else like this recently, and if there’s a known hotfix we can implement before DCMP.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T13:26:21.592Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":60.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460884,"topic_slug":"roborio-1-0-requires-restart-redeploy-upon-being-turned-on","display_username":"Eric (319)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23786,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-1-0-requires-restart-redeploy-upon-being-turned-on/460884/1","custom_user_title":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3349013,"name":"Taegen P","username":"tmpoles","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tmpoles/{size}/156834_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T13:29:23.251Z","cooked":"

Maybe give this a try? We had similar issues as you’re presenting also on a 1 and it was actually a code bug that crashed code instantly.

RoboRio booting without Code Programming
It happened to us a few weeks ago and we got stuck on it for several days. in our case turns out the robot code was loading but it was immediately crashing before the robot code light even turned green. turns out it was because we asked what the alliance color was before we were connected to the driver station. to solve this, every time we want to get the alliance color, we first check if the alliance is empty and only if it is not empty we check the color.
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T13:29:23.251Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460884,"topic_slug":"roborio-1-0-requires-restart-redeploy-upon-being-turned-on","display_username":"Taegen P","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/roborio-booting-without-code/457021/6","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"RoboRio booting without Code","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21565,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4476 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-1-0-requires-restart-redeploy-upon-being-turned-on/460884/2","custom_user_title":"4476 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3349033,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T14:00:37.157Z","cooked":"

I won’t lie. I just had a rollercoaster ride in my brain when i read this.

Ups and downs of. That doesn’t sound like the same issue… then the smack in the face of realization that we’re absolutely polling the alliance color without protection checking if fms is connected.

Thanks! We’ll try this!
